alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:06AM EST until January 10 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Upson, Talbot, Crawford and Taylor Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. Line Creek near Senoia affecting Fayette, Spalding and Coweta Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Americus, Peachtree City, Lovejoy, Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin, Thomaston, Molena, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way upstream from the bridge will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Wednesday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 3.8 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 03/06/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued at 300 PM EST.this afternoon at 515 PM EST.
